contentrichtext.text: {{Korean name|[[Yu (Korean name)|Yu]]}} {{Infobox Korean name| hangul=유득공| hanja=柳得恭| rr=Yu Deuk-gong| mr=Ryu Tŭkkong| }} '''Yu Deuk-gong''' (1749–1807) was a Korean scholar during the [[Joseon Dynasty]]. He is remembered today for his work in recovering the history of [[Balhae]], which had not generally been considered part of Korean history before his time. ==See also== *[[History of Korea]] *[[List of Koreans]] *[[List of Korea-related topics]] *[[Balhaego]] ==References== *Yu, Deuk-gong. "Yu Tŭkkong: Parhae in Korean history," pp. 186-187 in {{cite book|title=Sources of Korean tradition vol. 2|author=Ch'oe, Y.; Lee, P.H.; de Bary, W.T., eds.|publisher=Columbia|isbn=0-231-12031-1}} ==External links== *[http://mtcha.com.ne.kr/koreaman/sosun/man95-yuduggong.htm Dusan Encyclopedia article, in Korean] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Yu Deuk-gong | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Korean scholar | DATE OF BIRTH = 1749 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1807 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yu Deuk-gong}} [[Category:Joseon Dynasty writers]] [[Category:Joseon Dynasty people]] [[Category:Historians of Korea]] [[Category:1749 births]] [[Category:1807 deaths]] {{korea-bio-stub}}
